intro: Eokochia saxicola, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often brightly colored inflorescences. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky outcrops, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, aiding in water retention. Eokochia saxicola is often found in regions with Mediterranean or semi-arid climates, such as parts of California and the southwestern United States.
